Kemenkop Susun Omnibus Law Sektor UMKM
06 Nov 2019, 02:25 by Syarif Hasan Salampessy


Kemenkop Susun Omnibus Law Sektor UMKM

KBRN, Jakarta: Kementerian Koperasi dan UMKM menyiapkan Omnibus Law atau penyederhanaan Undang-Undang (UU) sektor Usaha Mikro Kecil dan Menengah (UMKM). Hasil penyederhanaan berbagai aturan tersebut berupa UU Pemberdayaan UMKM.
“Kami kumpulkan berbagai permasalahan dan menjadikan itu dasar pembentukan omnibus law. Apa saja regulasi yang menghambat, kita akan hilangkan," ujar Menteri Koperasi dan UKM Teten Masduki dalam jumpa pers di Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Sehubungan proses penyusunan Omnibus Law tersebut, Kemenkop UMKM sedang menyiapkan naskah akademik dan substansi perundang-undangan tersebut. Rumusan kedua hal tersebut akan diserahkan kepada Kemenkumham untuk penyusunan rancangan hukumnya. 
“Omnibus Law, kami sudah rapat dan koordinasi di Kemenkumham. Kami siapkan substansinya dan Naskah Akademik. Dalam penyusunan naskah akademik kami konsultasikan dengan para pelaku di UMKM apa saja regulasi yang menghambat,” papar Teten.
Berbagai pokok pengaturan akan tercantum dalam UU tersebut antara lain kemudahan berusaha UMKM, ekspor, pembiayaan, perlindungan hukum hak cipta hingga pencegahan fraud. 
Menurut dia pokok-pokok pengaturan tersebut merupakan ragam masalah yang sering dialami pelaku usaha UMKM. Hal ini menyebabkan UMKM nasional sulit berkembang.
Oleh karena itu lanjut Teten, insentif pajak yang diberlakukan pada UMKM akan ikut direvisi melalui omnibus law ini. Menurutnya, insentif pajak yang diberlakukan saat ini dinilai masih membebani UMKM.
Dalam PP Nomor 23 Tahun 2018 tentang Pajak Penghasilan atas Penghasilan Dari Usaha yang Diterima atau Diperoleh Wajib Pajak yang Memiliki Peredaran Bruto Tertentu sebagai pengganti atas Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 46 Tahun 2013 menetapkan tarif Pajak Penghasilan (PPh) Final sebesar 0,5% bagi pelaku usaha UMKM.
Menurut Teten ketentuan tersebut dianggap masih memberatkan pelaku usaha UMKM karena perhitungannya berdasarkan omzet. Padahal, sektor usaha lain dihitung berdasarkan keuntungan bersih atau laba.
"Insentif pajak 0,5% masih dikeluhkan UMKM. Karena dihitung dari omzet bukan dari keuntungan. Ini yang akan kita bicarakan dengan Dirjen Pajak," katanya.
“UMKM harus mempunyai kesempatan dan kemudahan berusaha, jadi harus ada keadilan bagi UMKM dengan menghilangkan regulasi yang menghambat. Kami diperintahkan buat omnibus law untuk memberi perlindungan hukum terhadap produk UMKM,” sambung Teten.
Teten mencontohkan terkait hak cipta. Pihaknya sudah bicara dengan Kementerian Hukum dan HAM. Dia meminta ada perlindungan hukum UMKM dari tindakan fraud dan mendapatkan playing field yang sama di market place.
“Jangan, di mall hanya ada barang-barang premium sedangkan lokal brand berada di pojok mall/2019),” tambahnya.

Kemenkop Arranges Omnibus Law for UMKM Sector
Nov 6, 2019, 02:25 by Syarif Hasan Salampessy


Kemenkop Arranges Omnibus Law for UMKM Sector

KBRN, Jakarta: The Ministry of Cooperatives and MSME prepares an Omnibus Law or simplification of the Micro Small and Medium Enterprises Law (UU). The results of the simplification of the various rules are in the form of the UMKM Empowerment Act.
"We collected a variety of issues and made them the basis for the formation of the omnibus law. Any regulations that hinder it, we will remove it, "said Minister of Cooperatives and SMEs Teten Masduki in a press conference in Jakarta, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
In connection with the process of drafting the Omnibus Law, Kemenkop UMKM is preparing an academic paper and the substance of the legislation. The second formulation will be submitted to Kemenkumham for the drafting of the law.
"Omnibus Law, we have a meeting and coordination at Kemenkumham. We prepare the substance and the Academic Manuscript. In preparing the academic paper, we consult with the actors in SMEs what are the regulations that are hampering, "said Teten.
Various principal regulations will be listed in the Act, including ease of doing business for MSMEs, exports, financing, copyright law protection, and fraud prevention.
According to him, the main points of the regulation are various problems that are often experienced by MSME entrepreneurs. This makes it difficult for national MSMEs to develop.
Therefore, continued Teten, the tax incentives imposed on MSMEs will also be revised through this omnibus law. According to him, the tax incentives currently being implemented are considered to still burden MSMEs.
In PP Number 23 Year 2018 concerning Income Tax on Income from Businesses Received or Obtained by Taxpayers who have a Specific Gross Circulation in lieu of Government Regulation (PP) Number 46 of 2013 stipulates a Final Income Tax (PPh) rate of 0.5% for MSME business actors.
According to Teten, the provision is considered still burdensome for MSME entrepreneurs because the calculation is based on turnover. In fact, other business sectors are calculated based on net profit or profit.
"The 0.5% tax incentive is still complained by MSMEs. Because it is calculated from turnover not from profit. This is what we will discuss with the Director General of Taxes," he said.
"MSMEs must have the opportunity and ease of doing business, so there must be justice for MSMEs by eliminating hindering regulations. We were ordered for an omnibus law to provide legal protection for MSME products, "continued Teten.
Teten gave an example related to copyright. He said he had already talked to the Ministry of Justice and Human Rights. He asked for UMKM legal protection from fraud and get the same playing field in the market place.
"Don't, in the mall there are only premium goods while the local brand is in the corner of the mall / 2019)," he added.
